head.title: Treasury Bill Auctions Set for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Bill Auctions Set for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.07 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.95 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 5.07 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.95 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TODAY
Clarksville, Tenn., $59 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
TOMORROW
Minnesota, $264.2 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
North Carolina, $85 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Seattle, $154.4 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Austin, Tex., Electric, $145 million of utility bonds. Citigroup Global Markets.
Bard College series 2007 Dutchess County Industrial Development Authority, $134.7 million of revenue bonds for New York Civic Facility. Goldman Sachs.
Clark County, Nev., for Las Vegas-McCarran International Airport, $112 million of passenger facility charge revenue bonds. Citigroup.
Clark County, Nev., for Las Vegas-McCarran International Airport, $103.7 million of passenger facility charge revenue bonds. UBS.
Colorado Regional Transportation District, $132 million of certificates of participation. Bear Stearns.
Foothill-De Anza Community College District, $150 million of election of 2006 general obligation bonds for Santa Clara County, Calif. Morgan Stanley.
Florida Housing, $175 million of debt securities. Citigroup.
Hays, Tex., Consolidated Independent School District, $60.8 million of debt securities. Banc of America Securities.
Judson, Tex., Independent School District, $243.6 million of debt securities. UBS.
Lamar, Tex., Independent School District, $150 million of debt securities for Fort Bend County, Tex. UBS.
Marion County, Fla., Hospital District, $62 million of health system refunding and improvement revenue bonds for Monroe Regional Health System. Raymond James & Associates.
Missouri State Environmental Improvement and Energy Resources Authority, $57.7 million of debt securities. A. G. Edwards & Sons.
Municipality of Anchorage, Alaska, $246.1 million of general obligation refunding bonds. A. G. Edwards & Sons.
Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority, $2.2 billion of debt securities. JPMorgan Securities.
Seneca Nation of Indians, New York, $160 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
South Dakota Housing, $100 million of debt securities. Citigroup.
Springfield, Ill., Electric, $225 million of revenue bonds. Citigroup.
Temple University Commonwealth System of Higher Education, $120 million of debt securities. PNC Capital Markets.
Texas Water Development Board, $209 million of state revolving fund subordinate lien revenue bonds. UBS.
The University of Miami, Miami-Dade County Educational Facilities Authority, $500 million of debt securities. Morgan Stanley.
Trimble County, Ky., Environmental Facility, $60 million debt securities for Louisville Gas and Electric Company.
University of Arizona, $106 million of certificates of participation. Citigroup.
Virginia Resource Authority, $239.3 million of debt securities for SRF Clean Water Program. UBS.
